title.narrative: MEPT - Movimento de Educação para Todos

description.narrative: The Education for All Movement (MEPT) is a forum that brings together Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs), associations and individuals who work and / or are interested in education, with the aim of strengthening civil society actions in favour of Education forAll (EFA), contributing to the institutionalization of positive experiences developed by them and outlining joint actions in the field of Education. MEPT emerged in 1999 following the preparation of the participation in the meeting of the WorldEducation Forum held in Dakar, Senegal in 2000. The vision of the MEPT is to have a country where all children, young people and adults have access to an education basic quality, without any kind of discrimination. MEPT is a member of the Africa Network Campaign on Education for All(ANCEFA) and Global Campaign for Education (GCE), and the coordinator of the Global Education Action Week activities. in this particular project MEPT will first design the advocacy strategy to be used by all partners. After that process, MEPT will carry out of promoting advocacy events with impact at regional and national level and promote learning and reflection moments on the intervention, to all partners and stakeholders. They will also promote influencing and Advocacy forthe institucionalization of REFLECT as a program of the Youth and Adult Education Subsystem (AEJA). Nevetheless, MEPT is going to participate in all duty bearer meetings as influencing spaces at national level and will also develop and implement roadmapfor virtual learning (webnars) for sharing models, approaches and transformative education practices piloted under the EfaC. finally, they will be envolved in the process of dissemination ofthe trainners Manual.

participating-org.narrative:
MEPT - Education For All Moviment, is a forum that brings together Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs), associations and individuals who work and / or are interested in education, with the aim of strengthening civil society actions in favor of Education for All(EFA), contributing to the institutionalization of positive experiences developed by them and outlining joint actions in the field of Education.
MEPT emerged in 1999 following the preparation of the participation in the meeting of the WorldEducation Forum held in Dakar, Senegal in 2000. The vision of the MEPT is to have a country where all children, young people and adults have access to an education basic quality, without any kind of discrimination. MEPT is a member of the Africa Network Campaign on Education for All (ANCEFA) and Global Campaign for Education (GCE), and the coordinator of the Global Education Action Week activities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: CSOs representing excluded and marginalised individuals have strengthened capacity and maintain and expand their civic space.
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act and to maintain and expand civic space
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act in favour of equality and equity
